body_html:
Something seems incorrect with the installation, that error would make sense if the shared library is from an older version.

Could you try uninstalling and re-installing first?

pip3 uninstall tensorflow tensorflow-gpu
pip3 install tensorflow

And if that doesn't help, could you run the following:

md5sum /home/jplu/.local/lib/python3.6/site-packages/tensorflow/python/_pywrap_tensorflow_internal.so
md5sum /home/jplu/.local/lib/python3.6/site-packages/tensorflow/libtensorflow_framework.sh
ldd /home/jplu/.local/lib/python3.6/site-packages/tensorflow/python/_pywrap_tensorflow_internal.so

That might give some clue as to what is messed up about the installation. Not quite sure how it ended up in this state.

body:
Something seems incorrect with the installation, that error would make sense if the shared library is from an older version.

Could you try uninstalling and re-installing first?
```sh
pip3 uninstall tensorflow tensorflow-gpu
pip3 install tensorflow
```

And if that doesn't help, could you run the following:

```sh
md5sum /home/jplu/.local/lib/python3.6/site-packages/tensorflow/python/_pywrap_tensorflow_internal.so
md5sum /home/jplu/.local/lib/python3.6/site-packages/tensorflow/libtensorflow_framework.sh
ldd /home/jplu/.local/lib/python3.6/site-packages/tensorflow/python/_pywrap_tensorflow_internal.so
```

That might give some clue as to what is messed up about the installation. Not quite sure how it ended up in this state.
